explanation: The report is correct. The for statement "for (i = 0, result = 0; !result && i < METAL_MAX_DEVICE_REGIONS; i++)" violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.2 in two ways: (1) the init clause initializes both the loop counter (i) and another object (result). Per the rule the first clause shall be empty or an expression that sets/defines and initializes the loop counter only — initializing "result" there is not permitted; (2) the loop condition uses "result" ("!result && ...") while "result" is assigned within the loop body (multiple assignments like "result = ..."), which is explicitly disallowed — the second clause must not use objects that are modified in the loop body. The third clause (i++) is acceptable, but the first and second clause violations make the loop not well-formed under Rule 14.2.
